page.title: 13COMMUTING
page.content: Since the war & the mass ownership of motor vehicles Flamstead has very much become a dormitory suburb of London. From 6.30am on weekdays there is a steady stream of traffic leaving the village for the journey via the M1 to offices in London.To a lesser extent people commute to the surrounding towns,there being very little employment in the immediate area.Commuters travel to London in various ways,car,train,bus & in one case bicycle.An average commuter leaves home at around 7.00am, travels 9 miles to St.Albans where he catches a train to St.Pancras.Often he then takes a bus or tube to his office.This is rpeated in reverse in the evening making the working day up to 12 hours & often a very unpleasant experience.
